Others: Dodgers' first road playoff victory since Game 5 of the 2021 NLDS in San Francisco, snapping a seven-game postseason skid while wearing the road grays.
Kiké Hernández got the start at third base in Game 4, and was 2-for-4, giving him eight different postseasons with the Dodgers in which he started a game.
Chris Taylor now has seven different years starting a postseason game with the Dodgers.
In the regular season, Taylor is one of two Dodgers to pull off the 3B-CF-LF trifecta in a game.
Dodgers six-through-nine batters had just eight hits, all singles, in 39 at-bats (.205) in the first three games of the NLDS, but improved to.313 in Game 4 with three RBI and three runs scored.
The 8-0 win in Game 4 was the Dodgers' most lopsided shutout win in postseason history.
The Dodgers are 10-6 in winner-take-all games in the postseason, including 5-3 during this current run of 12 playoff appearances in a row.
